info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Prowers, Kiowa and northeastern Bent Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 315 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 6 miles north of Haswell to 12 miles west of Sweetwater Reservoir to near Chivington to near Holly. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly, Eads, Granada, Sheridan Lake, Hartman, Haswell, Neeoshe Reservoir, Chivington, Brandon, Towner, Bristol, Sweetwater Reservoir, Neegronda Reservoir and Queens Reservoir. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
